<title level="1" pfs="">[The Stabbing Beast](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1007)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

The Stabbing Beast, the divine representative of [Norgorber](/Deities.aspx?ID=13), resembles an immense scorpion with a soft and strangely captivating voice. They appear on Golarion to bury secrets, support the faithful, or aid audacious thefts.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 44

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 42

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 39
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/StabbingBeast.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 15">[The Stabbing Beast](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1007)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Unique" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=161" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Fiend" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=70" />
<trait label="Herald" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=330" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #160: Assault on Hunting Lodge Seven](/Sources.aspx?ID=49) pg. 85</row>

**Perception** +27; [greater darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Languages**
[Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Protean](/Languages.aspx?ID=33); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +27, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +25, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +24, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +26, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +26, [Norgorber Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +28, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +24, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14) +26, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +29

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +6

**Dex** +8

**Con** +4

**Int** +3

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +3
</row>

**True Appearance** <actions string="Reaction" /> **Trigger** The Stabbing Beast is transformed with Change Shape and rolls for initiative; **Effect** The Stabbing Beast ends Change Shape.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 38 

**Fort** +27 

**Ref** +29 

**Will** +27 

+2 status to all saves vs. [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)
</row>

**HP** 275

**Immunities**
[poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)

**Resistances**
acid 15

**Weaknesses**
good 15

**Attack of Opportunity** <actions string="Reaction" /> Stinger only.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 40 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
pincer +29 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+10 slashing plus 2d8 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) and [Improved Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=27)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
stinger +29 ([fatal d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=178), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 4d8+14 piercing plus Stabbing Beast venom

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
shortsword +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [versatile S](/Traits.aspx?ID=200)),
**Damage** 3d6+10 piercing plus 2d8 [persistent bleed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29)

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
venom stream +29 ([range increment 60 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)),
**Damage** 5d10 poison plus blinding stream

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 36
- **4th**
[Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) (at will), [Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=164) (×3), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315) (at will)
- **5th**
[Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (×3), [Summon Animal](/Spells.aspx?ID=316) (×3; scorpions only)
- **6th**
[Modify Memory](/Spells.aspx?ID=200) (×3)
- **Constant (7th)**
[True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Blinding Stream**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) A creature hit by the Stabbing Beast's venom stream must succeed at a DC 33 Fortitude save or become [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1d4 rounds.

**[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=8)** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The Stabbing Beast takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid with a scorpion's tail and chitinous, full-body plate armor. This doesn't change their Speed or Strikes, except that their reach becomes 5 feet and they can't make pincer Strikes.

**Conjure Swords** <actions string="Single Action" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Conjuration](/Traits.aspx?ID=33), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) **Requirements** The Stabbing Beast is using Change Shape; **Effect** The Stabbing Beast summons one or two _+2 [greater striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [keen](/Equipment.aspx?ID=300) [shortswords](/Weapons.aspx?ID=43)_ into their hands. These weapons disappear if they leave the Stabbing Beast's grasp or if the Stabbing Beast ends Change Shape.

**Stabbing Beast Venom**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) While a creature is enfeebled from this poison, it is [doomed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9); **Saving Throw** DC 36; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 3d6 poison damage and [enfeebled 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13) (1 round); **Stage 2** 4d6 poison damage and enfeebled 2 (1 round); **Stage 3** 6d6 poison damage and enfeebled 3 (1 round)

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png">Heralds</title>

Nearly all deities have a specific representative known as a herald; heralds are as diverse in their appearances and abilities as the gods themselves. A creature with the herald type is always unique. The Stabbing Beast has been slain before—[Norgorber](/Deities.aspx?ID=13) is always swift to replace it with a new Stabbing Beast, allowing the new version to retain memories of the prior version's defeats to spur the herald on to do better in its new incarnation.
</aside>
